metadata.title: A Beginner’s Guide to an Office Wardrobe | Be Beautiful India
metadata.description: This article is about what to wear on your first day at the office and we’ve put together a few pointers that can assist you in picking an ideal office wardrobe.
metadata.keywords: office wear, office wardrobe, office outfit ideas, office wear guide, beginner's guide, formal wear, formal clothes for women,Fashion, fashion trends, fashion brands, dress by body type, celebrity style, street style, fashion how to videos, DIY videos

children.text: A Beginner’s Guide To An Office Wardrobe

As you gear up for your first day in the work world, it is extremely important to dress the part. Not only does dressing well help make an ideal first impression with your colleagues, it also helps instill a sense of confidence as you get ready for the challenges that are bound to come your way. To help ease the worried creases, we’ve put together a few pointers that can assist you in picking an ideal

In terms of the colour palette, navy blue is a perfect place to start. This colour tends to evoke power and is an understated technique to ensure that your colleagues take you seriously. Be it a pair of well-fitting navy trousers, a navy button down shirt or a navy shift dress – the colour can be incorporated in different ways. Pair your navy selection with a string of off-white pearls to finish up an elegantly,

As you start putting together your work wear wardrobe, begin with the essentials. A pair of black or navy blue trousers, a black blazer, a few plain blouses and a pair of comfortable black pumps are all great investments to begin with.

Especially applicable to women dressing for the corporate world, it is important to make sure that your selection is flattering but not very suggestive. In order to avoid attracting unwanted attention and roving eyeballs, it is always better to not pick something that is too tight, too short or something that has a low neckline. One of the key pointers for power dressing involves striking the right chord and picking a flattering silhouette as opposed to an evocative silhouette.

Finally, it is imperative to ensure that you keep your outfit selections simple and understated as you start your corporate career. A wardrobe that has an unprecedented amount of bling and shine can often times rub your colleagues the wrong way. It is always advisable to work towards an elegant, sophisticated and demure amalgamation. Most importantly, you need to believe that you look your best to allow your confidence to shine through as you pave your way to becoming the queen of the corporate jungle.

metadata.title: Fashion Faux Pas to Avoid | Be Beautiful India
metadata.description: Fashion faux pas which should be avoided. Read more.
metadata.keywords: Fashion Faux, how to avoid, Avoiding Wardrobe Blunders, Fashion Faux Pas for Women, Over-accessorising, loose clothes, ill-fitting clothes,Fashion, fashion trends, fashion brands, dress by body type, celebrity style, street style, fashion how to videos, DIY videos

children.text: Agonising over what to wear and making sure you look your absolute best has become part of every woman’s daily routine. All the same, in our endeavour to strive to keep up with the current fashion trends while still opting for a silhouette that is most flattering, there might be times where we stray into ‘unacceptable’ territory.

While  dressing for your best friend’s wedding, one of the biggest sins you can commit  is to outdo the bride with your bling quotient. Traditionally, wedding-appropriate  Indian attire tends to be fairly heavy with the sequins and bling. In such a  scenario, it is advisable to keep your jewellery to a bare minimum.
There is a  very fine line between choosing the appropriate necklace to complement your  plain white shirt and going overboard with multiple items of jewellery in one  look. If you are wearing a big

piece then the rest of your look has  to be left unaccessorised. On the contrary, you can mix multiple delicate  pieces like rings, bracelets and chains together if that’s your style. Loading  everything on at once, no matter how pretty will spell suicide for your look.

As a general  rule of thumb, irrespective of what you are wear, it is absolutely  imperative that you do not display your lingerie. Visible undergarments in the  form of showcased bra straps, inappropriately coloured undergarments that shine  through your attire, scooped necklines that leave nothing to one’s imagination  or even a visible panty line, are all fatal mistakes for everyday dressing.

The  final sartorial sin that each of us should solemnly swear to consciously avoid  making is associated with ill-fitting clothes. There are some of us who make  the error of wearing clothes that are far too tight while some of us sit at the  other end of the spectrum with clothes that are baggy and far too loose.  Irrespective of this, ill-fitting clothes are extremely unflattering and make  you look un-kept. Shop for sizes that are complementary to your silhouette and  flaunt those

metadata.title: Team FMW | Fashion tips to look like your favourite celebrity | BeBEAUTIFUL | Be Beautiful India
metadata.description: BeBEAUTIFUL blogger, Jeremi Cabral from Team FMW, walks us through a journey into how to achieve celebrity looks straight from your most devoured magazine covers. This month, Fashion Most Wanted puts the spotlight on Chitrangada Singh from the November issue of Harper's Bazaar and Sonakshi Sinha from the November issue of Grazia. From shopping tips to hair and make up tricks from experts, looking like your favourite star was never made so easy. Add a touch of the Lakme Eyeconic kajal to ring in the diva in you.

metadata.title: How to Dress for a Retro Party
metadata.description: From the crazed flapper 20s to the disco diva of the 70s, retro continues to have a huge impact on fashion and cool costume parties. Read on to find out just how you can nail this look for your next theme bash.
metadata.keywords: how to, retro party, dress up for retro party, 70’s dressing style, neon colour, polka dotted dress, 20s flapper dress, 60s inspired geometric look, cat-eyed sunglasses, Fashion, fashion trends, fashion brands, dress by body type, celebrity style, street style, fashion how to videos, DIY videos

children.text: How To Dress For A Retro Party
From the crazed flapper 20s to the disco diva of the 70s, retro continues to have a huge impact on fashion and cool costume
. Read on to find out just how you can nail this look for your next theme bash.

The 80s were big on neon. But, we understand that an  all-neon look can be a bit much. Play it smart by pairing your neutral blouse  with statement and edgy accessories. To add a pop of colour, go for a
green jacquard skirt that balances the ensemble without blinding your eyes.

Polkas  defined 50s fashion and they’re literally back every season. Instead of donning  the usual polka dotted tea dress or top, play it up a bit with an unexpected  pair of polka skinny jeans in a bright blue or salmon pink.

If you’ve watched The Great Gatsby a million times already, you  know what we’re talking about. The quintessential 20s flapper dress has  reinvented itself into a sexy sequinned number. Invest in a short number to show  off those gorgeous legs.

While  circles, blocks and lines have taken a shape of their own in fashion  chronology, the 60s inspired geometric look is only getting bolder. If you  dare, sport a multi – coloured geometric crop top with a white skort or  palazzos. Whatever the colours you are sporting in your top, pick one and wear  solid pumps in the same to finish the look
If  you are as much a risk-taker as we are
with them cat-eyed sunglasses. They are  right on trend and work all year round. Get inspired and go for the over-sized,  feline ones in pop colours.

metadata.title: Wardrobe staples for the new office goer
metadata.description: Getting ready for your first day at work can be just as intimidating as the job itself. To bring you some respite, we put together a list of office wardrobe staples that will get you looking your stylish best.
metadata.keywords: wardrobe staples, office wardrobe, office wardrobe essentials, formal wardrobe essentials, how to, office wear, Fashion, fashion trends, fashion brands, dress by body type, celebrity style, street style, fashion how to videos, DIY videos

children.text: Wardrobe Staples For The New Office Goer
Getting ready for your first day at work can be just as intimidating as the job itself. From deciding what to wear and following

rules, to wanting everyone to silently approve of your choices; work wear can be tricky and how! To bring you some respite, we put together a list of office wardrobe staples that will get you looking your stylish best.

Whether you hide behind the screen, or are out there being a working social bee, this role requires you to look people-ready at all times. As a marketing professional, invest in a great pair of everyday

and team it with a jumper and scarf for desk days. For client meetings, pair a pencil skirt with a smart blouse or a slim fit shirt. Since you’re mostly on the move, wear kitten heels or wedges to complete your look with minimal, yet statement accessories.

The great thing about working in fashion is you can have fun and make your own rules! To start off, put your money on key staples such as a great pair of jeans (light shades if you want to accentuate your lower body, dark if you want to slim it down), loose tees in pastels (pastels are a hot trend this season), formal and casual blousons, printed flared skirts, a pencil skirt and a standard jacket in tweed or plaid. Finish up with a pair of nude pumps that are such saviours and ballerinas for those on-foot days. Carry a sling or doctor bag to store your must-haves.
Are you a hard-core corporate girl

Oh, aren’t you a serious toughie? Working in a competitive corporate environment requires you to look put-together at all times. Play it safe-chic here by staying away from jeans, leggings or flared skirts. Stick to the no-nonsense list of trousers, skinny pants and pussy-bow blouses. To layer, stock up on some fitted blazers in basic shirts to go over your shirts. While you have to keep your accessories minimal, don’t shy away from the occasional statement piece in terms of a big cuff or a neckpiece.
Calling out finance and IT geeks

Working in a serious business environment can have some restrictions. A general rule – if it looks like you can wear it to a party, DON’T wear it to work. Stick to knee length pencil dresses in sombre colours minus the print. Invest in a good quality pantsuit for impactful meetings. Keep in mind that the length of your skirts should not be above the knee. Jeans, leggings, minis, crop tops are a strict no-no. Amp up with a rose gold/silver watch to go with your look.

metadata.title: Six Fun Ways To Reinvent Your White Shirt | BeBEAUTIFUL
metadata.description: Here are six ways to give your shirt a chic twist. Read on to know more.
metadata.keywords: how to wear white shirt, white shirt, ways to wear shirt, 6 ways to wear white shirt, Fashion, fashion trends, fashion brands, dress by body type, celebrity style, street style, fashion how to videos, DIY videos

children.text: Six Fun Ways To Reinvent Your White Shirt
It isn’t without reason that your trusty white shirt is called a ‘classic’. The white button down has proved to be a fashion loyalist and no matter what the
, it never lets you down. Here are six ways to give your shirt a chic twist.

Give your old cardigan a fresh look by pairing it  with your button-down tied at the waist into a knot. Throw on distressed jeans  and an embellished belt to give it a dressy makeover. You could also add a pop  of colour to your look with a headband.

shirt a sexy edge by pairing it  with a black pencil skirt or even a burgundy number. There’s something about  this look that never goes out of style. Be sure to strut in towering stilettos  and add some stacked delicate neck chains to complete your look.

Yes, there’s more than one way to wear your work  whites. Tuck your white staple under a classic black or checked pinafore to  graduate from schoolgirl to corporate chic. Wear with conservative block heels  or plain black closed toe shoes.

Dress up your white shirt by wearing a bow tie  around the collar. Opt for one in playful stripes, polka dots or even sequins.  Experiment with this look by teaming your bow tie shirt with a flared feminine  summer skirt. This look is boho chic all the way.

Embrace your androgynous side in a clinical look. Invest in  a pair of tuxedo pants that fit like second skin to go with your classic shirt.  Keep it edgy by adding a statement neckpiece and no-nonsense pumps. Pull your  hair back in a sleek bun for maximum effect.

Favourite  companion: Don’t we all love the quintessential white shirt and blue jeans duo?  The trick here is to work with minute details. Team your button down with  distressed boyfriend blue jeans that are rolled up till the ankle. Pair this  with electric blue
to stir up the colours. To add an extra touch  of ‘cool’, wear your favourite sunnies and you’re easy-breezy ready.

I can be overly shy and self conscious one day and feel like I can conquer the world the next. You have to try my caramel pudding and chicken soup and don't even dare playing charades with me—I'm super competitive. I love what I do and am always looking for a way to take it up a notch!

metadata.title: How to channel your inner gypsy with accessories
metadata.description: Channel your inner gypsy with accessories like accessories with flowers, Stack up, Fringe etc.
metadata.keywords: Look Boho Chic, boho style, how to, diy boho style, flowers accessories, bohemian look, hairstyle, Fashion, fashion trends, fashion brands, dress by body type, celebrity style, street style, fashion how to videos, DIY videos

children.text: How To Channel Your Inner Gypsy With Accessories

With the hard-core party scene finally behind you, it’s time to change up your style and welcome in the relaxation with a comfortable yet chic sense of dressing. Add a sprinkle of homespun ease to your look today by going

with the accessories. Whether you choose a flair of fringe, a beaded ankle necklace or a delicate Athenian headband, there are umpteen ways in which you can give your look a bohemian twist by changing up your accessories.
Now, you might not whole-heartedly agree with the aforementioned statement—but  it wouldn’t hurt to substitute your unoriginal diamond studs for a beautiful
wreath. You can sport this look to your next Sunday brunch or surprise  your loved one this romantic month. Soft, sweet and simple-this look will set  you in a league of your own.

To give your work look a fun, bohemian twist, stack away. Spruce up your  cotton pant-shirt combo with a stack of fun, eclectic beads and chunky bangles.  We’d recommend you accessorise a white and blue do with a stack of rustic gold,  pearl and crystal bling, peppered with colourful fun strands of beads. Not only  will this add a pep of colour to your outfit, it will also add a sense of  relaxation and positivity to your day.

Nothing says boho better than the combination of suede and fringe—and we’re  fans of both! If you’re grabbing a hot cuppa with the gal pals or catching the  latest flick, adding in a suede cross-body or messenger bag with a
trim  is your go-to accessory. It will give your entire look character and bring out  your easy-going yet notice worthy personality to the forefront.

As the esteemed Dorothy Parker once said "living well is the best revenge" and I take that piece of advice to heart. A babe in the woods for all things theatrical--I like to see drama in the mundane. Fresh off the yacht into this editorial world, I look forward to bringing in a fresh, beautiful perspective.

metadata.title: Marc Cain
metadata.description: Once you’re in the Marc Cain store, you can’t miss how architecturally contemporary it is. And you already start feeling like this is a true international shopping experience.
metadata.keywords: Store Review, Marc Cain store, Marc Cain store Review, international shopping experience, German brand Marc Cain, Marc Cain Collections, Marc Cain Essentials, Fashion, fashion trends, fashion brands, dress by body type, celebrity style, street style, fashion how to videos, DIY videos

children.text: Set in one of Mumbai’s crème de la crème locales, once you’re in the Marc Cain store, you can’t miss how architecturally contemporary it is. And you already start feeling like this is a true international shopping experience.

All of seven years old in the Indian fashion market, German brand Marc Cain is a  perfect midpoint between premium and luxury. Imagine a cross between London  Camden and a fancy Rio carnival, somewhere intersecting with a cold night in  Paris.

There’s  something for everyone here. As Rajni Nayak, Label Manager for Marc Cain, says,  “the Marc Cain woman lives in the modern world, is  self-confident, open and curious. She expresses herself through what she wears  - naturally and confidently.”

From  pretty watercolour florals and wild forest leaves to digital animal prints,  played down straight to your basic stripes and polkas, this is one of the best  stores to feed your print fetish. Occasionally you will chance upon a frumpy  graphic tee that you’ve had an overdose of already, but that’s easily  overlooked amidst the plethora of great things to find here. Most of the  collection is designed in Germany and manufactured in Romania, Italy and  Hungary. You know what the means - their quality will hardly disappoint you.

There’s one thing though, you can’t come here with a limit on your credit card.  While the collection is definitely unique, so is the price. We found a cashmere  scarf that Rs. 10,000. Unreasonable? Yes. Gorgeous? Definitely! It was equally  hard not to buy a pair of electric blue suede shoes at Rs. 15,000. If you must  want to have your Marc Cain loot, listen to our advice - be there on day one of  their sale!

Whether  you are 13 or 30, Marc Cain will appease your style sense in a way most stores are  still trying to. Look for cute shorts from their sports collection, sexy skirts  and bodycons from ‘Marc Cain Collections’ and those comfy basic tees from ‘Marc  Cain Essentials.’ And when you're really in the mood to indulge, buy that  cashmere scarf anyway.

metadata.title: What ‘not’ to wear to work | BeBEAUTIFUL
metadata.description: Work wear gets more ambiguous, we here at BeBEAUTIFUL bring to you some essential ‘what not to wear’ tips to avoid that wardrobe blooper.
metadata.keywords: what not to wear to work, work attire ethics, formal wear, how to, Fashion, fashion trends, fashion brands, dress by body type, celebrity style, street style, fashion how to videos, DIY videos

children.text: novice, there are many things to consider while kick starting your first day at the job and dressing right can be such a task! As work wear gets more ambiguous, we here at BeBEAUTIFUL bring to you some essential ‘what not to wear’ tips to avoid that wardrobe blooper.

Don’t  wear your opinion on the sleeve of your shirt or tee. You can find your voice  elsewhere, ladies. Offensive quotes on shirts can be very distracting at the  workplace and also slay away from professionalism.

There’s nothing tackier  than showing too much skin. Make sure to do a cleavage check for your tops,  blouses or tees before leaving your home. Bend down to your toes as low as you  can in front of the mirror to check that neckline. If it is too low, find a  scarf or wear a higher neckline to avoid a peep show.

While we all love our  jewels, let’s make sure the clanking of our baubles is not audible to the other  person over the phone. Accessorise minimally using delicate pieces and perhaps  one ring on each finger. There’s nothing more annoying than having your  necklaces or stacked up bangles ring aloud like bells in a meeting.

Yes, dressing to work on a Friday can be very tricky. But while it is the weekend, it still doesn’t give ripped jeans the green light. You’re best at wearing those jeans anywhere but at work. Invest in a pair of straight cut denim with minimal acid wash. Opt for a monotone throughout, such as dark or light blue.
The importance of clean and correct
cannot be over stressed. Whether you’ve stuck your feet in the mud or kicked a couple of stones, keep a clean cloth/brush handy in your
drawer to clean your shoes. Wear closed toe shoes to work and tick-tocking in heels is a strict no-no. Also, tuck your flip-flops in the holiday tote and bid them goodbye for work.

While there isn’t a rule in the office bible that says you can’t wear sleeveless, it’s still more favoured to be mindful of that. If you must want to show your worked-out biceps, wear a light cardigan or jacket over it.

Don’t mistake your  office for a nightclub. While miniskirts make an easy entry into your favourite  pub, they need to be exited just as quickly at the work place. Remember, it’s  never the same length when you sit, so pick knee length skirts and leave enough  room to move about freely.

metadata.title: One distressed jean worn five ways!
metadata.description: Our fashion blogger will show you how to wear it Monday to Friday, in delectable ways. Whoever said you couldn’t repeat an item of clothing, needs to read this.
metadata.keywords: how towear, jeans, denims, diferent ways to wear jeans, 5 ways to wear jeans, Fashion, fashion trends, fashion brands, dress by body type, celebrity style, street style, fashion how to videos, DIY videos

children.text: One Distressed Jean Worn Five Ways!

If you’re worried about being shot by the fashion police for wearing the same thing all week, we’re here to save you. Breaking the rules (as always), this week we throw the flash bulbs on that one can’t-do-without wardrobe staple and show you how to wear it Monday to Friday, in delectable ways. Whoever said you couldn’t repeat an item of clothing, needs to read this.
Our staple pick of the week - Distressed  jeans!

We’re  calling time out on your office trousers. Think comfy yet stylishly serious.  Spring some unpredictability into your look by wearing your distressed denim  with a cropped top, silky blazer and pointy heels. Add a pop of neon with bold  sunnies.

There’s  one thing you want for those flea market days – comfort all the way! Keep your  look minimalistic by simply throwing on a flowy, sheer button up over your  distressed jeans. Sparkle it up with shiny brogues and carry an all-purpose  tote to stack all your veggies and goodies.
Give  your mid-week art soiree a

finesse. Stand out from the crowd by pairing  your distressed jeans with bold prints and mix it up. Throw on a cool camo  oversized jacket over your denim and strut in your sexy heels. Pucker up in red  lips to earn extra points.

This  ought to be your favourite day because it’s time to go shopping! Dish out a  sporty look replete with comfort and style. Team your distressed denim with a  cutesy polka top and add a pop of pink in the form your mega dope
with your cute crush, dress up your denim with  a pretty floral blouse. Add studded or peep toe heels to lend some serious sexy  to your look and go make that date a night to remember!
